metadata.synopsis: You find a contemplative Astarion thinking about the danger we pose if we turn into mind flayers. He asks - hypothetically - if he had to kill us, how would we like to go? As an experienced murderer, he considers it a professional courtesy, but we might be outraged. He'll be enthusiastic when describing the different ways people can die - a fan talking about his favourite subject. If we threaten him, he'll be defensive and a little sulky.

19.speaker: Astarion
19.text: I saw you getting a lecture from our magical friend.

50.speaker: Astarion
50.text: I have to say, I thought you'd look worse, but no. Not a tentacle to be seen.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: That's what everyone's saying. Is it so strange?

25.speaker: Astarion
25.text: It's unexpected, but we shan't complain.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: I'm not taking anything for granted, of course. First sign of change and I'll have to stop that pretty little heart of yours.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I'm hoping it'll stay that way.

71.speaker: Astarion
71.text: Naturally. But I was thinking: what if it doesn't?

32.speaker: Astarion
32.text: Of course, first sign of change and I'll have to stop that pretty little heart of yours.

40.speaker: Astarion
40.text: I am open to suggestions. Knives, poison, strangulation - whatever you'd prefer.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: Killing me would rather decrease your odds of survival. Dramatically, in fact.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: Should that happen, my advice would be to drop your weapon and run. Very, very fast.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Don't make me choose! There are too many good options.

41.speaker: Astarion
41.text: Well, that's a little dramatic, don't you think?

69.speaker: Astarion
69.text: Well now you're just being close-minded. There are some lovely ways to go.

72.speaker: Astarion
72.text: I've watched urchins freeze to death on the street. It looks peaceful - just like falling asleep.

52.speaker: Astarion
52.text: Come on, humour me. If you had to choose...

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Poison, then. It should be painless at least.

61.speaker: Astarion
61.text: Then I suppose we'll just see what happens.

33.speaker: Astarion
33.text: Don't worry, darling. I like you. I'm sure I'll make the right choice.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: I'd rather have one of the others do it.

7.speaker: Astarion
7.text: Oh, I see how it is.

10.speaker: Astarion
10.text: Fine, but if they botch it - don't come bleeding to me.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Then I'll ask someone else to do it.

57.speaker: Astarion
57.text: A classic! One good thrust to the heart and you're gone.

58.speaker: Astarion
58.text: We need a good blade, of course. Don't want to waste time hacking and prodding with a dinner knife...

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: A fine choice! I can think of some nightshades that are deliciously fatal.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: If they're mixed well, you'll just close your eyes and drift away. And if they're not...
43.context: NodeContext: 'if they're not you'll die horribly.' is the unspoken end to that line.

63.speaker: Astarion
63.text: Well, I'm getting ahead of myself. This is all a worst case scenario, obviously.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Obviously. But that won't happen. It can't.

21.speaker: Astarion
21.text: If the last day has taught me anything, it's that the impossible is more likely than you think.

28.speaker: Astarion
28.text: Now, let's get some rest? The sooner we start tomorrow, the better our chances of keeping this hypothetical.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: And you? How should I kill you?

73.speaker: Astarion
73.text: Ha! Oh, my dear. I'd like to see you try.

75.speaker: Astarion
75.text: See you in the morning. Sweet dreams, darling.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Try it and I'll spill your guts.

4.speaker: Astarion
4.text: Don't be so pig-headed, I'm being practical.

3.speaker: Astarion
3.text: How much damage will you cause if you transform? How much blood can you bear to have on your hands?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: I'm afraid I'm deadly serious. Try it, and I'm taking everyone with me. Everyone.

18.speaker: Astarion
18.text: I like you. Rest assured, whatever happens, I'll make the right choice.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: If I had to choose, I'd want the knife. Make it quick.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: If I die, I'll take you with me.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: Ha! I do like you, you know. You've got fire.

56.speaker: Astarion
56.text: Whatever happens, I'll make the right choice.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Not sure. How would you like to go?

37.speaker: Astarion
37.text: I don't think poison is for me. Nor stabbing, come to think of it.
37.context: NodeContext: He's wondering if you can even poison a vampire.

66.speaker: Astarion
66.text: I've always felt decapitation was a fine choice. One good swing and then - nothing.

17.speaker: Astarion
17.text: But we were talking about you. What'll it be?

15.speaker: Astarion
15.text: A fine choice. Now, to use sword or axe? Or a saw? Hmm.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I could say the same to you.

62.speaker: Astarion
62.text: Indeed you could. We're all doing surprisingly well, given the circumstances.

47.speaker: Astarion
47.text: Sounds like you've been learning all about your gruesome future.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: So. Not a tentacle to be seen.

65.speaker: Astarion
65.text: I saw our gith friend inspecting you.
